title: Mordekaiser and Metal (@Riot, please...)
body:
Now then, we all were shocked and outraged once Riot announced they’d rename Mordekaiser to Lord of Death, which is not only bland and unimaginative but also deeply hurts anyone who got attached to the Master of Metal in any way.
 
I get riot’s reasoning, I really do. On the surface his affliction to Metal seems rather forced and there seems to be no connection between his themes of Pain, Undeath and Metal. But there is one! If you could just open your eyes and try and form your own characters and be creative there’s plenty of reasoning to keep Mordekaiser the Master of Metal, even if only at heart.
 
Metal is an element, which has various aspects I’d like to delve into in order to make Morde’s theme more coherent.
 
Metal is a great conductor for Heat, electricity and the like… So what makes Undeath and unholy energy any different than say warmth? They’re both types of energy and  thus need some kind of conduit for them to spread quickly.
>Metal could be a conduit for Mordekaiser’s undead energy, being the locus of his power, further increasing his tremendous dominion over the very essence of death and serving as his primary element to spread his unholy element<
 
 
Metal is cold, emotionless, lifeless. It’s perfect for a being that exists to only bring suffering upon the living. Metal is a manmade material often associated with destruction and torture (weapons, torture devices) and thus should be attributed to Mordekaiser who seeks to bring the gift of eternal pain upon his enemies.
It being of no organic/living descent would make it an inhospitable body to posess, resulting in a state of pure agony for any soul, accustomed to a living body, being bound to a shell of metal.
>Metal should serve as Mordekaiser’s prison, his very soul being tormented by the cold, grim element as its cold grip on his soul inflicts pain upon his very essence, it should be akin to an Iron Maiden, tearing at him, making him suffer. Yet Mordekaiser’s sheer force of will makes him endure and even use the object of his own torment to inflict even greater pain unto his enemies, a cruel irony and a statement to how powerful Mordekaiser’s will truly is<
 
 
Metal as a genre of Music; Metal music is powerful, it’s brutal, it’s heavy riffs and beat just resonate so well with a heavy metal Juggernaut, a being so powerful it bends life and death to his will and whose pain is only a mild distraction to him.
Morde would make one hell of a mascot for any Metal band, being the epitome of what Metal would be as a person.
 
 
Metal is what we’ve known since his release; Mordekaiser, the Master of Metal is a classic, a meme, he’s been in our hearts ever since we first saw him. He’s one of league’s oldest champions and should be treated with respect.
>Embrace Mordekaiser’s Metal theme instead of shunning it. He’s due for a Visual update so add back his Metal effects and don’t use their absence as a cheap way of justifying the change of title. He deserves being acknowledged as an iconic character whose themes have the potential to truly make him unique to any game and not turn him into the stereotypical deathknight<
 
 
Please riot, reconsider your approach on Morde, Lore and Gameplay wise.
Make him truly live up to his name of Murder Emperor!
 
~M.M

Just as Swain's title reflects his defining personal trait rather than his job, Mordekaiser's should define who he is as a (former) person, not what he does in the world. Master of Metal does a much better job of this than Lord of Death, especially when tied to character history, as you have demonstrated. I don't think it is so much a matter of "can't think anything to relate death with metal", but something in the tune of "Mordekaiser has too much going at once thematically".

A hard truth of designing characters for something like LoL, is that you have only so much space to work with, and you still need to deliver a coherent package.

There is no doubt that Narrative could find dozens of ways to deliver on the Death Metal fantasy. *But this is not solely a lore issue*.

Mordekaiser's thematics also need to be delivered on both his kit and his visuals. In the lore, his domain over death can be framed as equal to his power over metal, but in gameplay, is not that easy.

Mordekaiser, in game, naturally pulls towards a Death theme as his most iconic moment is enslaved the soul of a fallen opponent. Trying to push against that inertia makes Morde have a fractured identity, similar to pre-rework Sion.

Now, if there was a way to turn the ghost from *Children on the Grave* into some sort of anguished Metal Golem animated by the imprisoned soul of Mordekaiser...

To be honest, I do like the new direction. The title itself needs some work, but 'Master of Metal' really wasn't cutting it. It was made during a time when champions could exist as parodies and jokes. Gangplank was the sterotypical jolly pirate. Sion was the Schwarzenegger. And Morde was the walking metal music reference.
But they're changing all that now. Gangplank is now deathly serious. Sion is an undead berserker. And Morde is just... well, Morde. Ruler of the undead. Lord of the Shadow Isles. 'Master' of death.

The metal effects were fine in a time when Morde existed by himself, when he was just the mysterious man of Iron. But now that they're trying to group champions up and flesh out the world, that doesn't work anymore. The Shadow Isles have long been a place where the material world doesn't matter, where the soul and spirit are paramount. It seems contradictory that a champion who is essentially THE poster child for the Shadow Isles, would be tied to such a material thing. Being trapped in a metal prison is one thing. Using it is another.

And, lastly

> Metal is a great conductor for Heat, electricity and the like… So what makes Undeath and unholy energy any different than say warmth? They’re both types of energy and thus need some kind of conduit for them to spread quickly.
> >Metal could be a conduit for Mordekaiser’s undead energy, being the locus of his power, further increasing his tremendous dominion over the very essence of death and serving as his primary element to spread his unholy element<

This just seems like you're stretching for straws, honestly. Theres just as many metals that resist heat, and quite a few that don't conduct electricity as well. So should metal then be something that resists Morde's undead powers, making him weaker?
